title: Music Options
review:
Instagram‚Äôs song library has to be one of the most frustrating parts of the app. For a platform that thrives on trends, reels, and creative expression, you‚Äôd think they would have the most up-to-date music catalog. Instead, it feels like we‚Äôre stuck with scraps.

Half the time, the actual trending songs that are blowing up on TikTok or Spotify aren‚Äôt even available. And when they are there, they‚Äôre often random remixes, sped-up/slow-down versions, or some bootleg copy instead of the real track. It completely kills the vibe when you‚Äôre trying to make a reel that matches a popular trend but Instagram just‚Ä¶ doesn‚Äôt have the song.

What makes it worse is how inconsistent it is. Some creators have access to certain songs, while others don‚Äôt because of region or account type. Meanwhile, Instagram keeps pushing reels as their main feature, but how are we supposed to compete or keep up with trends if we don‚Äôt even have the right tools?

At this point, Instagram‚Äôs music library feels like a watered-down version of what social media should be offering. Until they fix licensing, update their catalog regularly, and actually give users access to the same trending music that everyone else is using, the song selection is nothing short of horrible.

‚≠ê 1/5 ‚Äî only because silence isn‚Äôt an option.

title: Instagram's grid layout
review: The recent changes to Instagram's grid layout have impacted the visual consistency that many users, especially creatives and brands, rely on. The traditional square grid offered a cleaner, more balanced way to present content, and its removal has disrupted the overall aesthetic appeal of profiles. A return to the classic format would enhance user experience and maintain the platform's visual integrity.

title: My experience with instagram recenlty
review: Instagram should take more care in how it handles account bans, because banning people without a clear reason or explanation is unfair and discouraging to its users. Many people put time, effort, and creativity into building their profiles, only to have their accounts suddenly disabled without warning or proper justification. Mistaken bans hurt real people and damage trust in the platform. Instead of unfairly removing accounts, Instagram should improve its review process, provide clear communication, and give users a fair chance to appeal.

title: Ban
review: My friends and I were recently banned from Instagram without any explanation, despite the fact that we have always followed the Community Guidelines and Terms of Use. None of us posted harmful content, engaged in harassment, or violated the rules in any way. We primarily use Instagram to stay connected with our friends and share everyday moments, so it was very surprising and frustrating to suddenly lose access to our accounts without warning. We believe this may have been a mistake or an automated error, and we respectfully request a thorough review of our accounts so that we can be reinstated as soon as possible. We never posted anything offensive, hateful, or inappropriate, and we always used Instagram responsibly just to connect with friends and share positive content. Out of nowhere, our accounts were disabled without warning, and we weren‚Äôt even told what the reason was. This feels extremely unfair and frustrating, because Instagram is one of the main ways we stay in touch with people. We truly believe this was a mistake, and we want our accounts to be restored so we can get back to using Instagram in the way it‚Äôs meant to be used

title: Absolutely No Support
review: I‚Äôve been on Instagram for a while now, and I‚Äôve never encountered this issue before. But I currently cannot follow anybody without having to request. It randomly started a couple months ago, and no matter what I try (waiting weeks for it to resolve, not following/unfollowing for awhile, updating app, etc) nothing works. My account hasn‚Äôt been flagged either. No spammy activity. I‚Äôm all green (in terms of account status) and I haven‚Äôt hit the follow limit (not even close), yet I cannot follow anyone. I‚Äôve messaged Instagram about this issue multiple times, I repeatedly hit the ‚Äúlet us know‚Äù button when trying to follow others, but nothing seems to get through. The app is great if you don‚Äôt have any issues, it‚Äôs garbage if you do. Because no one is there to help you resolve any of these issues. Even the help section is out of date, so there‚Äôs nothing there that can help me resolve this issue‚Äî which is pretty massive, considering I rely on it to connect with others in my industry. So, use at your own risk and know that the help desk is vacant if you actually need some help.

title: account suspended
review:
My account was disabled on August 12, 2025 for allegedly violating Instagram‚Äôs policies. I was informed that the reason was related to CSE, an allegation that is not only completely untrue, but also deeply disturbing and unacceptable.

To be completely honest, I was shocked and horrified by this action. I have never engaged in, supported, or condoned anything remotely related to such harmful and illegal content. My account has always been maintained in full alignment with Instagram‚Äôs Community Guidelines, and I have always made it a priority to create a safe and respectful space for my audience.

I strongly believe this may be the result of a serious mistake or misunderstanding, and I respectfully request an immediate, thorough re-review of my case and would love to get my account back. If I've unknowingly done something wrong, I would be grateful for the opportunity to understand and correct it.

Thank you for your time and attention, and I hope to hear from you soon with a positive resolution.
